Class Types_DBHelper

java.lang.Object
org.pokemondatabase.DBHelper.Types_DBHelper
public class Types_DBHelper extends Object
PURPOSE/PRIMARY FUNCTION

Used for the Pokémon table to accept SQL queries (with execute and getExecuteResults) and prepare the SQL queries using Select, insert, update, delete, and selectToTable. Holds all current column types as variables.

IMPORTANT DEPENDENCIES
  • DBHelper: DBHelper calls this class to bring it into scope when other classes call the DBHelper.

Created using the SQLHelper GUI

  • Field Details

    • type_id

      public static final String type_id
      Defines constant values for the Type database columns.

      These constants are used throughout the application to reference database fields.

      • type_id – Type’s unique Type number.
      • type_name – Type’s name.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • type_name

      public static final String type_name
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

      public Types_DBHelper(DBHelper dbHelper)
      Class Constructor Used to bring DBHelper into the scope
      Parameters:
      dbHelper - Brings the Database Helper into scope to be able to access the DB.

  • Method Details

    • insert

      public void insert(Integer type_id, String type_name)
      Insert a new record into the database
      Parameters:
      type_id - Type ID (Primary Key)
      type_name - Type Name

    • delete

      public void delete(String whatField, String whatValue)
      Remove a record from the database
      Parameters:
      whatField - The column you want to reference (Should be the Key)
      whatValue - The value in the column to specify the row to delete

    • update

      public void update(String whatField, String whatValue, String whereField, String whereValue)
      Update a record in the database
      Parameters:
      whatField - The column you want to reference (Should be the Key)
      whatValue - The value in the column to specify the row to update
      whereField - What column needs to be updated
      whereValue - What is the new value to be updated

    • select

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> select(String fields, String whatField, String whatValue, String sortField, String sort)
      Completes a SQL "select" command
      Parameters:
      fields - The fields to be displayed in the output
      whatField - The field to search within
      whatValue - The value to search for within whatField
      sortField - The field that the data will be sorted by
      sort - Use ASC or DESC to specify the sorting order
      Returns:
      {ArrayListinvalid input: '<'ArrayList
